reviewText:
MDK is a must own! MUST OOOOWWWNNN !!! The first time I saw this game was on a PC in a Tandy Electronics store in early 1997. lol, boy I tell you, I played it as much as I could. Which was only 15 mins. But when I had to leave, I knew I had to get away from games like Doom, Quake, Heretic, Descent, Blakestone 3D, Wolfenstein 3D, Duke Nukem 3D ... etc. These 3D platform shooters were the next big thing!

The graphics amazed me back then. Now that I play it, I gotta admit it isn't as great as I had remembered, but the gameplay is incredibly fun that you'll pay no attention to the graphics. There’s this really cool slanting to the camera angle when you run left or right. I also find the parachute mechanism as integral and addictive to the gameplay as bullet time is in the Max Payne series.

MDK is about 6 hours long. For the amount of content to make things interestingly non-repetitive, I'd say this was well laid out by the developers. Some people might think the game is short. And maybe it is by today's standards. But if I remember back to those days as a kid, if a game was fun, you'd replay it again. It was that simple. And I would gladly load MDK up every now and then just to blast around and have fun today. That's the way it should be!

I can't even understand some of the pure genius of ideas in this game. Like I remember shooting this alien or whatever in the head and his eye popped! I shoot him in the nose and that got mashed. I mean like I shoot Ellis or Coach in the eyes in L4D2 and they don't pop ... you know what I mean? lol. Incredible detail and very imaginative game. Too much to explain. You have to play it to see it.

The control scheme is a bit wonky. You have to remember this was at a time where using the mouse to look around on PC wasn't that common. But I personally don't find it a bother. There are some people that have created modern mouse configurations for this game. But I recommend to use the keyboard old-school with the mouse only for sniping. Having said that, this game would be very user-friendly with a controller.

The music is pure awesomeness! It gives such great atmosphere. The sound effects like the gun shooting doesn’t get tiring.

What I don't understand is why the Steam version of this game lacks the ending escape sequence movie clip followed by this French music video. You'll need to obtain MDKEND.FLC and MDKBZK.MVE and place them in the MDK/MISC/FLIC directory to view the ending like normal. Thank god for the Internet and Google search, this problem is easily remedied.

The Steam overlay also doesn't work. So you'll need a program like Zeckensack's Glide Wrapper or nGlide. Apparently these programs also fixes wrongly displayed textures and windowboxing" which the game defaults to.

Overall despite nearing 2 decades old
date: MDK makes it into my top favourite games of all time. It is so refreshing that it makes me wonder why a lot of triple A titles of today that use laser technology to scan actors into the computer as 3D models
hoursPlayed: life like level designs and Hollywood-like plots fail to draw me in! I would give MDK a personal score of 93/100."
voteText: December 12, 2013

reviewText:
Well done Kurt!

MDK is a fast third person shooter that puts you inside Kurt's remarkable coil suit to fight against aliens that are trying to conquer Earth. For that, you're equipped with an infinite-ammo chain gun and a sniper rifle, combined with a lot of items (nuclear bombs, did I mentioned that?!) that can be obtained along the game (I mean NUCLEAR BOMBS!).

The campaign is linear, with six worlds to complete. It's a classic, tremendously funny. I still can enjoy it like I did in 1999.
If you're not familiar with classic games, give it a try on a sale. Otherwise you probably already have it on your library. ;-)

NOTE: The Steam version comes up with some bugs on newer systems (such as slowdowns and missing textures). There's a patch available that fix them all.

reviewText:
The Steam release of MDK is a bit of a letdown. It inspired me to make a fan patch for the game since, not only does it not include any glide wrappers to make the game compatible with modern systems, it also missed a LOT of original content from the game such as cutscenes, artwork etc.

Using my patch though you should be able to experience the game as it was meant to be.

In my opinion MDK is a pretty awesome shooter. It's insanely easy to play (especially with a modern WASD+mouse control setup), easy to grasp and while the game is a bit short, it has an insane amount of variety in level designs and graphics, especially for its time when most shooters looked like brown and grey corridors (*cough*Quake*cough*) and the game also features more open arena-like spaces a lot.

A DEFINING feature of the game is the sniper rifle which attaches to your head like a helmet. Back in the 90's, this must've been the FIRST shooter I remember that had a sniper weapon that felt as good and simple to use as this. And it zooms in without any kind of pixelation as well.

The music is also stellar and composed by Tommy Tallarico who obviously took a lot of influence from Danny Elfman in his score for the game, using a lot of synthesizers mixed with rich orchestral sounds and themes. The soundtrack is as varied and whimsical at times as the game is and fits perfectly.

Graphically the game ranges from being really colorful to having almost gothic HR Giger'esque designs, especially with the main protagonist. The low polygon count gives the game a very unique look though it uses a lot of very impressive graphical tricks for its time such as a world consisting entirely of mirrored surfaces that still looks awesome today.

All in all, MDK, or Murder Death Kill as it's originally called, in my opinion is an underrated must-play title for all shooter fans.

reviewText: MDK is a brilliant action game! The shooting feels good and the game is also quite hard at times. Although the graphics look dated, graphics don't make a game. Although it's not always clear were you're meant to go, and the shooting does get a little repetitive towards the end, the game isn't too long any way. As far as enemies go, there aren't really all that many different types, they are mostly re-skins. As for the level design, it can be confusing at times, but each level is vastly different from the last, which is good to see. Overall, I think this game is great, and you should try it out!

reviewText: As old as MDK 2 is it still looks sweet given it age but I enjoyed that game enough to take a step even farther back... to the orignal MDK. Given how old this game is, I expect the graphics to take an ugly step back and man I wish I was wrong on that note. I was surprised Steam even had this game given it's age, problem was it was a bad port for some of us. Problem with me was I was getting Kurt and the basic background background and nothing else with the game. Fortunately under Steam's tech support there is a patch that fixes that problem. If you play this game, the controls are going to be crude from what you are used to. When your mouse isn't in free look mode, that's quite an adjustment when you've done years in first person shooters. Even so I think this game is worth a look back and I can already tell It has the same loopy humor MDK 2 has. Maybe not with voice acting anymore but the name's of the weapons you pick up says it all. I've just gotten this game to run properly and can tell I'm going to have fun with it, even though I'm still arkward with the controls. Is this game even worth a look see? Most of you would say no given it's age and most of us whom played this as kids are fathers now so no I don't expect this generation of kid like it, much less show interest. But that's not surprising... this game is really old and didn't hold up well at all. Can I really recommend this game honestly? No... sad to say unless you already had an interest in this game. This game is well past it's prime but it's still worth a glance back in my option.

reviewText:
Short but sweet, even thou I´m recommending this game, I´m going to write the negative first:

I´m not recommending this game if you:

- Suffer from motion sickeness

- Can´t stand old games

- Can´t stand games not taking themself not that seriously

- You think that game lenght is important (This game is 3 to 4 hours long and it can be done in less)

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Now that´s out of the way, this was a nostalgic trip for me, the action, the humor and the variety make this game even better than I remenber.

The action is simple but neat, you don´t need worry much about your aim, is all about the movement, there´s platforming and is easy as pie since Kurt (the protagonist) uses a parachute, the levels are such a treat to watch even if it can hurt your eyes, but if you´re used to this, them is even better, levels in this game are colorful and creative, they make fighting with the same enemies so much fun, all of this is spiced up by the...

The humor, this game was made by Shiny, creators of two of the funniest games ever (Earthworm Jim and Earthworm Jim 2) and this game feels more like a proper sequel to EJ2 than EJ3D ever felt, even thou is silly humor, is so out of sight that, it will make you laught, and even if it doesn´t you´ll feel relaxed during the whole experience, since the setting is such a joke, also...

The variety, this game was so ahead of it time, that make you trace all new single-player/third person release to this game, you do more in this game than just Shooting and Platforming, you carpet bomb enemies, snowboard down a hill, infiltrate enemies, solve action puzzles and snipe enimies, I´ll go so far to call it Call of Duty 4 Before Call of Duty 4.

Wraping up, this is an outstanding game, so fun you won´t mind how short it is, you might want to play it again... or jump right to the sequel.
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText:
The BEST game I have ever played!

I played MDK with my brother for the first time in 1998 and it has always been my favourite of all games.
I remember how I was using the controls for shooting and sniping and my brother was coordinating with the arrows, ah the memories!
We usually spent 1-2 hours on a single level (there are 6 levels in total) and we enjoyed ourselves like never before, we managed to immerse into the game, to feel the thrill and the excitement of the main character...

This game is old, yes, the graphics are not that great, but everything else is. It just is. A masterpiece.

PS
Just remember, if you get this game - download the Steam Game Patch made by Alyxx (http://steamcommunity.com/app/38450/discussions/0/864973123467667345/) as it fixes all the graphical issues that the game has on modern computers.

reviewText: A cult classic from Shiny Entertainment. This game is from a time when you played most PC games using the arrow keys for movement and the Crtl key to Fire, Spacebar to Jump. reviewText:
While indeed yes, I played MDK in the past and I enjoyed it I have a few things to say about the game on newer PC's.

Users with Windows 10 may experience issues with levels not displaying and even to the point of the characters not displaying as well the game experienced a major slow down while going into the display options.

Someone may have to test it on Windows 7,8 and 8.1 to see if it works on there.

Sound still works and the Camera behaves just as the character is there and is moving around.

I can't say for sure if this is a issue with older display drivers or absent ones due to them being from the time that MDK was made and no longer supported and or avaliable.
